page.title: 06A Description of the area
page.content: The people living in the area are,in the majority,Welsh_speaking;although, in 1968,an influx of about 1000 miners from Durham did create special problems in the local schools.These problems were,however,overcome by the creation of "Welsh for Learners" courses;these were so successful that, by now,the children and grand_children are fluent in the Welsh language. The village of Pontyberem can boast how it has the largest and best_equip- ped primary school in the county of Dyfed,for until 1983 its buildings housed the local secondary school which,in that year,was disbanded under the Education's scheme for the re_organisation of education in the valley (there are now only 2 comprehensive schools whereas there were 2 high_schools and 1 grammar school).
